ygData.subject: RE: Why do so many clerics think they're wizards?
ygData.msgSnippet: It s been my experience that the majority of all mob attacks on a cleric (due to them healing) can be avoided.  Just dont be too quick with throwing a heal.  I
ygData.messageBody:
It's been my experience that the majority of all mob attacks on a
cleric (due to them healing) can be avoided. Just dont be too quick with
throwing a heal. I never heal anyone in my party if they have taken
lessthan 2 bubs of damage. Depending on what is attacking them I typically
wait till they have taken 3 bubs of damage. This doesn't apply to
wizards, I always heal them almost as soon as they start to drop.


If the puller is running back to the group and will need a heal as soon as
they are in range, I always tell my party to get ready to clear me,
healing someone right as the party starts to engage a mob is almost always
guaranteed to get you attacked.

I always said clerics had the best taunt in the game....:)

On Tue, 16 Nov 1999, Rose wrote:

> From: "Rose" <rliu@...>
>
> > can't or doesn't do it in time. I play with a good friend so
> > when I asked him about this
> > he says that he is taunting the mob constantly, but it won't
> > leave me. So, don't just assume
> > the warrior isn't doing HIS job. It seems the Mobs will stick
> > with a healer until he's dead
> > sometimes.
>
> Aye. For those of you who has never play a tank, FYI taunt isn't worth a
> crap around low 20s and below. What I am telling you guys is to always have
> another escape/survival plan if the tanks are unable to pull the mobs off.
>
> If you play with a ranger, ask the ranger to snare or root (snare is better
> though) the mob. Those spells works as good as taunt...if not better.
>
> BTW once u are at 2 bubbles of health...it is close to impossible for anyone
> to pull those mobs off. If you ever get that low on health, and the mob is
> still at full health or there are still more then one mob standing...just
> cast divine aura and run towards the zone.
>
> -Imogen
>
> >
